features.title: Feral Form
description: During your turn, you can transform using a bonus action, granting resistance to non-magical and non-silvered bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while transformed.
You can't cast spells or speak. Transforming breaks your concentration on a spell you've already cast.
Your Armor Class equals 10 + (2 x <CON> modifier).
Your equipment merges into your new form, however you retain the effect of the magic items you are attuned with.
Your claws become natural weapons that deal *2d8* + your `STR` modifier slashing damage.
Your bite become a natural weapon that deals *1d10* + your `STR` modifier piercing damage.
You can choose to become one size larger.
If you don't already have it, you gain dark vision out to a range of 60 feet.
You have advantage on `WIS` (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
Your hit point maximum increases by 3 x your Lycanthrope level.

The transformation last 10 minutes and you can revert to your normal form earlier by using a bonus action. Once you have transformed the maximum number of times for your lycanthrope level, you must finish a long rest before you can transform again.

features.title: Regeneration
description: Using a bonus action, you can regenerate non-silvered damage by rolling <5d4>.

features.title: Improved movement
description: Starting at 2nd level your speed increases by 10 feet while you are transformed.
At 11th level this bonus persist in your humanoid form.

features.title: Hunter instinct
description: Starting at 3rd level, while you attack a creature that is missing hit points you can deals an additional `1d6` to the damage.
You can use this feature once per turn.

features.title: Primordial strength
description: Starting at 6th level, your unarmed strikes and natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

features.title: Feral instinct
description: Starting at 7th level you have blindsight with a range of 10 feet.
Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness.
Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

features.title: Improved critical
description: Starting at 9th level your attacks score a critical hit on a roll of `19` or `20`.
Additionally starting at 15th level, your attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

features.title: Natural Weapons
description: Starting at 11th level your claws damage becomes die a `d8` and your bite damage die becomes a `d10`.

features.title: Onslaught
description: Starting at 15th level when you move at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a `STR` saving throw or be knocked prone. The DC of the saving throw is the following.
> Onslaught DC = 8 + `PROF` + `STR`
If the target is prone, you can take a bonus action to make one bite attack against it.

features.title: Feral constitution
description: Starting at 17th level while transformed and drop to 0 hit points You automatically revert to your humanoid form with 1 hit point. After you use this privilege you can do a disengage action by spending you reaction.

features.title: Indomitable savagery
description: Starting at 18th level you have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with your claw and bite attack.

features.title: Children of Darkness
description: At 3rd level, you no longer have your eyes hindered by the presence of darkness. You can see through normal and magical darkness, up to a range of 120 feet.

In addition, you can use the extra action granted by your Action Surge to cast Darkness or Shadow Blade, without spending a spell slot. *The spell is cast at a level equal to your proficiency bonus, and Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.* Once you cast any spell using this feature, you can't do it again until you finish a long rest.
